conclusion: To determine the distance fallen during the 0 to 10-second interval using the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows the velocity (v) in meters per second as a function of time (t) in seconds.
The area under the graph between two points in time represents the distance traveled during that interval.
From t = 0 to t = 10 seconds, the skydiver's velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s.
To find the distance fallen, calculate the area under the curve from t = 0 to t = 10.
The area under the curve can be approximated by calculating the area of a triangle.
The base of the triangle is the time interval, which is 10 seconds.
The height of the triangle is the final velocity, which is 20 m/s.
Area of the triangle = 1/2 * base * height.
The area under the curve is exactly 100 square meters, meaning the distance fallen is 100 meters.
